ai.summary: Kilmory Bay is a coastal hike in the UK covering 12.2 km with moderate difficulty. The trail offers sea views, seabird life, and rugged shorelines. Expect exposed sections and uneven surfaces; suitable for hikers with moderate fitness.
ai.terrain_summary: The route follows coastal tracks: cliff-top paths, rocky shoreline, and grassy tracks. Ground is uneven with loose stones, mud after rain, and some steep ascents/descents. Watch tide-dependent sections; some parts may be slippery near inundated rocks.
ai.safety_notes: Check tides and weather before starting; stay on marked paths and maintain a safe distance from cliff edges; be prepared for sudden changes in wind and rain; wear sturdy footwear with good grip; carry a map, compass or GPS and a charged phone; inform someone of your plan and expected return time; bring water and snacks; carry a small first aid kit and whistle; in low light, be prepared for earlier darkness.
recommended_gear: Head torch or flashlight (for low light)
Lightweight rain cover or dry bag
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) for milder weather and longer daylight; winter hikes are possible but can be stormy and hazardous.

seo.title: Kilmory Bay Hike – 12.2 km Moderate Coastal Trail in the UK
seo.meta_description: Plan a 12.2 km moderate coastal hike at Kilmory Bay in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, best season, and gear.
